replies.bodyText:
this is feb 2016. current is 0.13.0

this is because of some dependency chained issues, this version 0.10.1 solves for some version conflicts in maven. you can test it by removing the servo-core depdendency and see what happens on build time
replies.author: sarbull

timeline.bodyText: As identified in call we would be good to make this https - as we've already self-certified as using secure protocols for egeria?
timeline.author: planetf1

replies.bodyText: Also how does the static server get launched if a user just builds this project
replies.author: planetf1

replies.bodyText:
Also how does the static server get launched if a user just builds this project

npm install in odpi/egeria-ui and npm run serve and it will start on http://localhost:8080
replies.author: sarbull

replies.bodyText:
As identified in call we would be good to make this https - as we've already self-certified as using secure protocols for egeria?

This can be passed as an ENV variable at deploy time, for development purposes it can remain http:// as de development server in egeria-ui is http://
replies.author: sarbull

timeline.bodyText:
For the consumers of the current jar (where I think the main question will be how to ensure the static files are served - maybe in an additional container)
See also /Users/jonesn/src/egeria/open-metadata-distribution/open-metadata-assemblies -- this is where this artifact is used to create a distribution archive, which we then use for our containers - specifically using the definitions in src/main/assemblies/egeria-omag.xml
The actual launch of the UI container for k8s is in open-metadata-resources/open-metadata-deployment/charts/odpi-egeria-lab/templates/egeria-ui.yaml & we have similar for compose in open-metadata-resources/open-metadata-deployment/compose/tutorials/egeria-tutorial.yaml
timeline.author: planetf1
